page.title: 13LIFE OF A MINER IN HATFIELD
page.content: A typical miner rises at 5.00 am and walks to work. At the pithead baths he changes into working clothes and then collects his 'safety lamp' and 'self rescuer' which helps him breath safely through poisonous and harmful gases. He then goes to the time office where he collects two brass discs. One is handed over before going down the pit and the other as he comes out. He then goes to the shaft side where a lift takes him to the pit bottom. Then a 'paddy train' takes him nearer to his place of work,where he works with a 'Dosco dinter header' which cuts out roadways to develop new faces. Most miners work a 7h 15m shift. Although their job is dirty and dangerous they soon adjust to it and quite enjoy it. Their main hobbies are fishing, darts, and pidgeon racing.
